text: welcome to twominenglish.com teaching
you English through two-minute lessons
in this lesson let's learn about the
meaning and use of the phrasal verb
breakdown
let's discuss the phrasal verb break
down today
I know a bit about it breakdown means
crying
you're right when one is unable to
control his emotions he or she may break
down in tears however breakdown can also
mean a damage in a machine or car when
it stops working
funny you mentioned it my car broke down
earlier today
ouch sorry about that Nina but breakdown
also means to resolve something ending
in a long dispute for example finally
the case broke down when Henry agreed to
compensate yes breakdown means solving a
task this phrasal verb also means as
in-depth analysis of something breaking
something else into parts
exactly a complex problem may be solved
by breaking it down to a number of
smaller steps or parts
absolutely it means to divide into
smaller parts or to separate but it also
means to force someone to give up to
tell a secret or make someone agree to
do something
yeah like breaking up a terrorist group
that's breaking down something
breaking down sometimes also means to
destroy or ruin it
so many possibilities we should listen
to some conversations with examples now
great idea
Ron why don't you service your car
I will do it in the evening
it might break down any moment now
yeah I know my dad finally broke down
and gave me some money so I can get it
fixed
Ron can you look at this math problem
hmm linear algebra
it's always better to break down
problems into smaller steps
how you've always been so good at
solving problems
I wish I could be quick with real life
problems they break me down all the time
don't worry Ron these Family Matters are
just a temporary father
why so gloomy today Candace
nothing much I had to lock horns with my
brother
what happened
he broke down the doghouse
then
then what he ruined it so I broke down
crying
sorry to hear it
oh it's fine he promised to build a new
one today
my car broke down earlier today
it might break down any moment now
it's always better to break down
problems into smaller steps
he broke down the doghouse
so I broke down crying
